description: Returns a set of profiles that belong to the same matching group using the matchId or profileId. You can also specify the type of matching that you want for finding similar profiles using either RULE_BASED_MATCHING or ML_BASED_MATCHING.

parameters.name: DomainName
parameters.description: The unique name of the domain.

parameters.name: MatchType
parameters.description: Specify the type of matching to get similar profiles for.

parameters.name: SearchKey
parameters.description: The string indicating the search key to be used.

parameters.name: SearchValue
parameters.description: The string based on SearchKey to be searched for similar profiles.

nested_items.name: ProfileIds
nested_items.description: Set of ``profileId``s that belong to the same matching group.

nested_items.name: MatchId
nested_items.description: The string matchId that the similar profiles belong to.

nested_items.name: MatchType
nested_items.description: Specify the type of matching to get similar profiles for.

nested_items.name: RuleLevel
nested_items.description: The integer rule level that the profiles matched on.

nested_items.name: ConfidenceScore
nested_items.description: It only has value when the MatchType is ML_BASED_MATCHING.A number between 0 and 1, where a higher score means higher similarity. Examining match confidence scores lets you distinguish between groups of similar records in which the system is highly confident (which you may decide to merge), groups of similar records about which the system is uncertain (which you may decide to have reviewed by a human), and groups of similar records that the system deems to be unlikely (which you may decide to reject). Given confidence scores vary as per the data input, it should not be used as an absolute measure of matching quality.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The pagination token from the previous GetSimilarProfiles API call.
